programme.desc: Beverly encourages Erica to write the perfect Hanukkah song for the holiday pageant, while Barry also sets his sights on becoming a hitmaker with music. Elsewhere, Adam is upset that some of his favorite things from years past aren't any more. (cc).

programme.title: Speechless *
programme.desc: Maya's holiday spirit comes as a big surprise when the DiMeos get ready for Christmas, but her upbeat mood is challenged after the family's van is stolen—with all their gifts inside. Meanwhile, Ray joins the school choir when he's worried about getting into college, though he'll have to battle his brother over a coveted solo. (cc).

programme.title: Modern Family *
programme.desc: A fancy holiday gala at school finds Manny and Luke trying to avoid a disastrous outcome thanks to a texting mistake. Eager to pitch in, Claire, Gloria, Mitchell and Cameron volunteer to help at the dance and get involved in the night's shenanigans, including Claire and Gloria trying to set up a single mom with the principal, while Mitchell takes an interest in the school bully. (cc).

programme.title: Blackish *
programme.desc: Dre's determined to have the best Christmas ever in light of Zoey being college-bound. Meanwhile, Johan and Gigi join the family to celebrate the holiday; and Bow babysits Gigi's newborn, triggering memories of how difficult caring for an infant can be. (cc).

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc).

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: "Come on down!" Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Valspar Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Valspar Championship in Palm Harbor, Fla. Last year, a 30-foot birdie putt on the third hole of sudden death gave Jordan Spieth a victory over Patrick Reed and Sean O'Hair. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Arnold Palmer Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill Golf Club in Orlando. Matt Every won this event for the second straight time last year, knocking down a 17-foot birdie putt on the final hole to defeat Henrik Stenson by a single shot. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: WGC-Dell Match Play
programme.desc: WGC-Dell Match Play championship match and third-place match at Austin Country Club. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Puerto Rico Open
programme.desc: Puerto Rico Open final-round play at Coco Beach Golf & Country Club in Rio Grande. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Houston Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Houston Open in Humble, Texas. J.B. Holmes won here last year. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: The Heritage
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Heritage on Hilton Head Island, S.C. Jim Furyk got his 17th Tour win and his first since 2010 here last year, defeating Kevin Kisner in a playoff. He shot a 63 in the final round. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Valero Texas Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.2 million Valero Texas Open at TPC San Antonio. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Zurich Classic of New Orleans
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Zurich Classic of New Orleans. Justin Rose won a weather-delayed tourney last year, playing 30 holes on Sunday and defeating Cameron Tringale by a single stroke. It was the seventh PGA win for Rose. (cc).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Wells Fargo Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $7.3 million Wells Fargo Championship in Charlotte. Rory McIlroy dominated this event last year, setting a new tournament scoring record by five shots; shooting a course-record 61 on Saturday; and winning by seven strokes. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Players Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Players Championship at the TPC at Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. Trailing by five shots with six holes to play, Rickie Fowler played the last six holes at six-under par, forced a playoff and won on the fourth extra hole. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: AT&T Byron Nelson
programme.desc: Final-round play at the AT&T Byron Nelson in Irving, Texas. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Dean & DeLuca Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Dean & DeLuca Invitational in Fort Worth. Last year, after Brandt Snedeker missed a 12-foot birdie putt on the final hole, Chris Kirk knocked in a seven-footer for par to win this event by a single stroke. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Memorial Tournament
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Memorial Tournament at the Jack Nicklaus-designed Muirfield Village Golf Club in Dublin, Ohio. Last year, Sweden's David Lingmerth defeated Justin Rose on the third hole of a playoff to claim his first PGA Tour win. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: St. Jude Classic
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.2 million St. Jude Classic in Memphis. Argentina's Fabian Gomez got his first Tour victory in this event last year, shooting a final-round 66 to defeat England's Greg Owen by four shots. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Quicken Loans National
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Quicken Loans National at Congressional Country Club in Bethesda, Md. Troy Merritt got his first PGA Tour victory in this event last year in Gainesville, Va., defeating Rickie Fowler by three strokes. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Barracuda Championship
programme.desc: Barracuda Championship final-round play at the Montreux Golf and Country Club in Reno. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: WGC-Bridgestone Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $9.5 million WGC-Bridgestone Invitational at the Firestone Country Club in Akron. Ireland's Shane Lowry got his first PGA Tour win here last year, shooting a final-round 66 to defeat Bubba Watson by two strokes. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Barbasol Championship

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: RBC Canadian Open

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Travelers Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.6 million Travelers Championship in Cromwell, Conn. Last year, Bubba Watson got his second victory in this event, holding off a charging Paul Casey and winning on the second hole of a playoff. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: John Deere Classic

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: The Barclays
programme.desc: Final-round play in The Barclays, the year's first FedExCup Playoff event at Bethpage State Park in Farmingdale, N.Y. Last year, Jason Day shot a 63 and a 62 in the final two rounds to win this $8.5 million tourney by six shots over Henrik Stenson. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: Deutsche Bank Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Deutsche Bank Championship at the TPC of Boston in Norton, Mass. This playoff event was won by Rickie Fowler last year, who came from three strokes back with eight holes to play to defeat Henrik Stenson by a single shot. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: BMW Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the BMW Championship in Carmel, Ind. Last year in Lake Forest, Ill., Jason Day led wire-to-wire to win this tourney by six shots over Daniel Berger. It was his fourth victory in his last six events. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (live) (cc).

programme.title: New Mexico Bowl: Texas (San Antonio) at New Mexico

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Written and directed by the Coen brothers, this quirky crime thriller follows the desperate plight of a car salesman who is so far in debt that he hires two thugs to kidnap his own wife so that he can reap the cash ransom from her wealthy father. Stars Frances McDormand, William H. Macy and Steve Buscemi.

programme.title: The Hateful Eight
programme.desc: Eight strangers seek refuge from a blizzard in this Western mystery from writer and director Quentin Tarantino. Features an all-star cast, including Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell and Jennifer Jason Leigh.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: The saga of James Bond, agent 007 of Her Majesty's Secret Service, is given a fresh injection of high-octane thrills with this reboot of the spy series starring Daniel Craig as a newly minted, wet-nosed "blunt instrument" assigned his first mission: take down the sinister La Chiffre, an international arms dealer selling dangerous weapons to terrorists. Eva Green and Judi Dench costar in this box office blockbuster that relaunches the Bond franchise.

programme.title: 2016 Week 14
programme.desc: Exclusive NFL Films highlights of every game, every week of the football season. Plus, hard-hitting commentary and expert analysis from host James Brown, Phil Simms, Boomer Esiason, Michael Irvin and New York Jets Brandon Marshall(c).

programme.title: Blue Velvet

With the help of a young lawyer she embarks upon a lengthy legal battle to recover what rightfully belongs to her family(n).(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Electrocuted in a hairdryer mishap, womanizing ad exec Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is suddenly able to hear the thoughts of the opposite sex. At first, Nick thinks he's been given a terrific advantage in the bedroom and the boardroom, but soon his psychic gift turns the once-clueless Nick into a better father, employee and man, a transformation that does not go unnoticed by his beautiful boss Darcy (Helen Hunt). Alan Alda, Marisa Tomei, Lauren Holly, Ashley Johnson and Mark Feuerstein costar in this comedy blockbuster(n).(n)

programme.title: Carol
programme.desc: In 1950s New York, a young woman meets an alluring older woman, trapped in a convenient marriage, and when they take a road trip across the country, they find themselves in the throes of a forbidden love that falls outside of the conventions and laws of the time. Stars Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara(n).(n)

programme.title: Only You (1992)
programme.desc: This romantic comedy stars Andrew McCarthy as Clifford, a loser who is dumped by his fiancee on the eve of a pre-wedding vacation to Mexico. His tickets are nonrefundable, so he invites the sexy Amanda (Kelly Preston), whom he meets in a bar, to accompany him on the trip. But while Amanda plays sexual head games with Clifford and ruins his getaway, he falls for the beautiful travel agent (Helen Hunt) who set him up on the trip in the first place. Daniel Roebuck and Joel Murray co-star in the directing debut of Betty Thomas ("Dr. Dolittle")(n).(n)

The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history. (cc).

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: Robin Williams and Nathan Lane play long-time companions forced to play it straight in this remake of the farce "La Cage aux Folles." (cc)(n).

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A professional thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A dangerous sniper traps a self-centered NYC publicist in a public phone booth. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Scream 3

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: A teenage single mother tries to overcome the feeling she's made the wrong choices in life. (cc)(n).

programme.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

There he leads the patients in rebelling against the tyrannical head nurse (Best Actress Louise Fletcher). programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote Pennsylvania farm. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Hard to Kill
programme.desc: In a coma for seven years, a presumed-dead detective vows to avenge the murders of his wife and son. (cc)(n).

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains

programme.title: Parenthood

programme.title: A Little Chaos
programme.desc: Gifted architect Sabine de Barra is hired to design a section of the elaborate landscaping at the Palace of Versailles for Louis XIV. The job brings with it gender and class barriers, and she also must contend with renowned landscaper André Le Notre, with whom she develops both a professional and romantic relationship. (cc)(n).

programme.title: Dead Presidents

programme.desc: When Mr. Conductor (Alec Baldwin) runs low on magic dust, he seeks help from a new young friend (Mara Wilson) and her grandfather (Peter Fonda) in finding a way to replenish his supply. Billy: Russell Means. Stacy: Didi Conn. Mr. C. Jr.: Michael E. Rodgers. Patch: Cody McMains. Young Burnett: Jared Wall. Young Tasha: Laura Bower. Lily's Mother: Lori Hallier. (cc)(n).(n)
